Judul: The Aesthetic Experience of Artworks and Everyday Scenes
Abstrak:
Some of our aesthetic experiences are of artworks. Some others are of everyday scenes.
The question I examine in this paper is about the relation between these two different
kinds of aesthetic experience. I argue that the experience of artworks can dispose us to
experience everyday scenes in an aesthetic manner both short-term and long-term.
Finally, I examine what constraints this phenomenon puts on different accounts of aes-
thetic experience.
